title: Would you be able to walk if you severed your femoral artery? - Quora

response.answer_text: Possibly. Blood loss in a completely severed femoral artery would be profound and clinical signs of shock would manifest quickly. It may well be possible to walk a few steps whilst maintaining pressure on the bleeding point. A child in the UK died after being attacked in 2008. Immediately after the incident, he was able to run to a nearby stairwell where he collapsed with an incised wound to his thigh.
